descriptionSet.description: On this advertisement for Garrard's jewellers, we see a statue of king Karl V. riding on a horse, fighting an enemy on the ground with a long weapon. Around the statue, detailed information can be seen concerning the services offered by the advertising company as well as contact details in- and outside India.

inscription.text: Jewellers to T.M. the king & queen Jewellers to HM Queen Alexandra
By Appointment Goldsmiths to the queen of England Race Cups & Trophies for all sports.
Jewellery department. Garrards beg to draw special attention to their magnificent stock of jewellery, suitable for wedding, bridesmaids and complimentary presents at lowest London prices.

Special designs free. Garrard & Co. Ld. have the largest stock of presentation silver and silver gilt plate in India, comprising cups, bowls, tea, services, jardinieres, ewers, candelabra. - correspondence invited. - designs submitted. - Garrard & Co. Ltd. were awarded Grand Prix for English silver work at the Franco-British exhibition.
Selections of goods sent to approval.

Garrard & Co., Ld. 1/1 Dalhousie Square, Calcutta; and 25, Haymarket, London, invite attention of ruling chiefs, princes. nobles and gentry to their unrivalled resources for the manufacture of state chairs, howdahs, palenquins, state paraphernalia etc. in gold and silver. - Makers to the house of England for nearly 200 years. - By appointment to his excellency, Baron Hardinge of Penshurst, Viceroy and Governor-General of India.
The King George V. solid 18-carat gold. International jumping trophy. Designed and made by Garrard's.
Garrard. (Established 1721) 1/1 Dalhousie Square, Calcutta; and 25, Haymarket, London, S.W.
Telegrams: Empearl, Calcutta Durbar Premises: Cashmere Gate, Delhi
P.O. Box 364, Calcutta. New London Premises: 24, Albemarie St. 17. Grafton St., W.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art"

titleSet.title: Poster advertisement of "Garrad" Co, the makers of race cups and trophies
